poem:
**Morning Headlines**

The ashes rise from tombs, a history  
in smoldering scripts, while fractured voices  
swirl like dust devils. Exile becomes  
a shadow until it wraps itself  
like a shawl around the shoulders.  
Promises of land under new suns  
echo in the corridors, calling—  
unlikely birds—across a vast and ancient sky.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tomb of Assad’s father set on fire in Syria hometown – Middle East crisis live 3.55pm GMT Syria’s new prime minister said the alliance that ousted president Bashar al-Assad will “guarantee” the rights of all religious groups and called on the millions who fled the war to return home, reports AFP. Assad fled Syria after a lightning offensive spearheaded by the Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) group and its allies. With Assad’s overthrow plunging Syria into". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
